content: Hi @Jake Goulding ; I was trying today to follow the instructions at https://github.com/shepmaster/rust/tree/silicon-bootstrap/silicon . This is perhaps a silly question, but: Does one need to actually have installed the Xcode beta and use it as the default for clang for those instructions?
I wasn't sure from the instructions whether the use of Xcode-beta was just to get the right SDKROOT in place.
(The reason I ask is that I tried a couple times today to follow the instructions there, but kept hitting an error of the form clang: error: invalid version number in 'MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=11.5')
I guess your instructions there do in fact say "You'll need to have installed the Xcode beta" (emphasis added)
@pnkfelix to my knowledge, only Xcode 12 beta can target aarch64 apple hardware
